Package org.neo4j.kernel.impl.store.record

Class AbstractBaseRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.kernel.impl.store.record.AbstractBaseRecord
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CountsEntry, DynamicRecord, IndexEntry, MetaDataRecord, PrimitiveRecord, PropertyRecord, RelationshipGroupRecord, TokenRecord, TokenScanDocument
    public abstract class AbstractBaseRecord
extends Object
    records are intended to be reusable. Created with a zero-arg constructor and initialized with the public initialize method exposed by the specific record implementations, or cleared if reading a record that isn't in use. Regarding secondary unit there are three state fields involving secondary unit. This is an explanation of what they mean and how they relate to each other:
    • requiresSecondaryUnit() set when a record is prepared, at a time where actual ids cannot be allocated, for one or more reasons. This state is accessed at some point later and if this record doesn't have a secondary unit it assigned already, such an id will be allocated and assigned setSecondaryUnitIdOnLoad(long) and the setSecondaryUnitIdOnCreate(long) flag raised because it was set right now.
    • getSecondaryUnitId() set when a large record requires a secondary unit. If such a large record is created right now (and not loaded from store) the setSecondaryUnitIdOnCreate(long) should also be set to reflect this fact.
    • isSecondaryUnitCreated() whether or not the secondary unit in this record (assuming it has one) was created now and wasn't there when it was loaded from the store

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        protected AbstractBaseRecord initialize​(boolean inUse)

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears this record to its initial state. Initializing this record with an initialize-method doesn't require clear the record first, either initialize or clear suffices. Subclasses, most specific subclasses only, implements this method by calling initialize with zero-like arguments.

      • copy

        public AbstractBaseRecord copy()

      • getId

        public long getId()

      • getIntId

        public int getIntId()

      • setId

        public final void setId​(long id)

      • setSecondaryUnitIdOnLoad

        public void setSecondaryUnitIdOnLoad​(long id)
        Sets a secondary record unit ID for this record on loading the record. Setting this id is separate from setting requiresSecondaryUnit() since this secondary unit id may be used to just free that id at the time of updating in the store if a record goes from two to one unit.

      • setSecondaryUnitIdOnCreate

        public void setSecondaryUnitIdOnCreate​(long id)
        Sets a secondary record unit ID for this record on creating the secondary unit. This method also sets the setSecondaryUnitIdOnLoad(long). Setting this id is separate from setting requiresSecondaryUnit() since this secondary unit id may be used to just free that id at the time of updating in the store if a record goes from two to one unit.

      • hasSecondaryUnitId

        public boolean hasSecondaryUnitId()

      • getSecondaryUnitId

        public long getSecondaryUnitId()
        Returns:
        secondary record unit ID set by setSecondaryUnitIdOnLoad(long) or setSecondaryUnitIdOnCreate(long).

        public boolean requiresSecondaryUnit()
        Returns:
        whether or not a secondary record unit ID has been assigned.

      • secondaryUnitToString

        protected String secondaryUnitToString()
        Returns:
        information about secondary unit, like so: 
        • +secondaryUnit:123
          where this record requires a secondary unit and has that unit ID assigned to 123
        • -secondaryUnit:123
          where this record doesn't require a secondary unit, but has one assigned i.e. shrinking down to one unit
        Returns empty string if this record neither requires a secondary unit nor has one assigned.
